base_creation.$comment: What type is it? A date?

capacity.title: Battery max capacity by design, in mWh

real_capacity.title: Real battery capacity which decreases with battery lifetime, in mWh

systemdrive.title: Wether it is the system partition (Windows only)

volumn.title: Filesystem system name, ie '/dev/sda1' or 'host:/path' for NFS

base64.$comment: Guess this is a base64 encoded
base64.title: uuencoded EDID trame

altserial.title: Alternative monitor serial number computed from known manufacter formula and if different from SERIAL

description.title: Interface name, ie 'eth0' on Linux, 'AMD PCNET Family Ethernet Adapter' on Windows

management.title: Wether it is a remote management interface such as HP iLO, Sun SC, HP MP

virtualdev.title: Wether is is a virtual interface

slaves.tile: list of component interfaces, for aggregate and bridges, with ',' as delimiter

examples: Microsoft(R) Windows(R) Server 2003, Enterprise Edition x64

name.title: Operating system name ('Distributor ID' in LSB terms)

version.title: Operating system version ('Release' in LSB terms)
Remote management software or firmware version

items.title: A physical connection points including ports, motherboard slots and peripherals, and proprietary connection points

examples: Intel Corporation Haswell-ULT HD Audio Controller

image.ttile: Image used for creation (Docker image for instance)

components.$comment: What type of element is this? Would need examples.

sysmac.title: Remote device mac address, from CDP/LLDP

ifdescr.title: Remote device port description, from CDP/LLDP

ip.title: Remote device IP address, from CDP/LLDP

sysdescr.title: Remote device system description, from CDP/LLDP

lldp.title: Is a LLDP (Link Layer Discovery Protocol) or CDP (Cisco Discovery Protocol) connection

iflastchange.title: Time since last status change ('X days, HH:MM::SS' format)

ifstatus.title: Port status (up(1), down(2), testing(3), unknown(4), dormant(5), notPresent(6), lowerLayerDown(7))

examples: Platform  : linux buildvm-14.phx2.fedoraproject.org 4.16.6-302.fc28.x86_64 1 smp wed may 2 00:07:06 utc 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 gnulinux

defines: use64bitall use64bitint usedl usedtrace useithreads uselargefiles usemallocwrap usemultiplicity usemymalloc=n usenm=false useopcode useperlio useposix useshrplib usesitecustomize usethreads usevendorprefix usevfork=false

etime.title: Time (seconds) needed to run the inventory

databases.title: List of databases in the instance
